required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Scapholunate Ligament Partial Tears; Tear Localization, Extrinsic Ligament Injury Association and Conservative Treatment Responses Prior to Instability
clinical_study.official_title: Retrospective Trial, Scapholunate Ligament Partial Tears in Stable Wrist

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate scapholunate ligament partial tears regarding tear localization, extrinsic ligament accompaniment in stable wrist and accordingly to scrutinize conservative treatment response.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients admitted with radial sided wrist pain without carpal instability were retrospectively evaluated. Scapholunate interosseous ligament (SLIOL) tear localization, grade of injury and associated extrinsic ligament injuries were examined on MRI. Patients treated conservatively and recalled at their first year for re-evaluation.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in visual analog scale for pain, disabilities of the arm, shoulder and hand questionnaire and Patient-Rated Wrist Evaluation scores from baseline and at first year
primary_outcome.description: Visual analog scale for pain scored from 0 to 10, disabilities of the arm, shoulder and hand questionnaire scored and Patient-Rated Wrist Evaluation scores from from 0 to 100 were scaled at initial admission, before treatment and at their first year recruitment after treatment for assessment conservative treatment success.

study_pop.textblock: 109 of 311 patients admitted with radial sided wrist pain had SLL and/or extrinsic ligament injury on MRI, 49,5% (n:55) were female, 50,5% (n:56) male with mean age 34 ± 10 (age range, 12-67 years).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Scapholunate ligament Injury
- Wrist Extrinsic Ligament Injury
Exclusion Criteria:
- Scapholunate Dissociation
- Radiological and clinical instable wrist
- Carpal bone fracture
- MRI imaging artefact

overall_official.affiliation: Medipol University Hospital Department of Orthopedics
Medipol University Hospital Department of Radiology

clinical_study.keyword: Scapholunate interosseous ligament, Extrinsic wrist ligaments, Carpal instability, MRI of wrist, Wrist ligamentous injury,
